sections.title: What is TLA?
sections.intro: Terra Liquidity Alliance turns staking rewards into liquidity incentives through community voting.

content.value: TLA is a ve(3,3) system built by ERIS Protocol for the Terra ecosystem. Instead of inflationary token emissions, it redirects a portion of Terra's staking rewards to incentivize liquidity providers. Voters decide which pools receive rewards, creating a market-driven approach to liquidity.
The Flywheel

items: Lock LUNA or LSTs → Gain voting power
Vote on pools → Direct rewards to your preferred LPs
LPs stake → Earn from the pools you voted for
Projects bribe → Compete for your votes
More liquidity → Better trading → More activity → Repeat

content.value: Five Participants

items: Voters — Lock tokens, vote on reward distribution, earn bribes + rebases
Liquidity Providers — Stake LP tokens, earn rewards based on votes
Projects — Add bribes to attract votes for their pools
Terra — Provides staking rewards, builds Protocol-Owned Liquidity via take rate
Traders — Benefit from deeper liquidity and lower slippage

sections.title: The Four Buckets
sections.intro: TLA organizes pools into four categories, each with its own reward allocation.

rows: LUNA paired with major crypto assets

content.value: Each bucket has its own voting gauge. Voters distribute their power within buckets, and rewards flow proportionally to the pools that receive votes.
The Single bucket was added in October 2024 through the Alliance Reform proposal, replacing the old Chain Alliance which was spending ~$1M/year on external chains with minimal return.

sections.title: Epochs & Timing
sections.intro: TLA operates on weekly cycles called epochs.

content.value: Each epoch runs Sunday to Sunday (12:00 UTC). Voting happens during the epoch, and rewards are distributed based on the votes when the epoch ends.
Epoch Phases

items: Active — Voting is open, bribes accumulate
Processing — Votes tallied, rewards calculated
Distribution — Rewards sent to LPs based on votes

content.value: Vote early in the epoch to maximize your bribe earnings. Late votes still count for reward distribution but may miss some bribes.

sections.title: Rewards Explained
sections.intro: Three types of rewards flow through TLA.

content.value: 1. Liquidity Incentives
Staking rewards converted to z-assets (zLUNA) and distributed to LP stakers. The amount each pool receives depends on votes.
2. Voting Incentives (Bribes)
Projects add incentives to attract votes. If you vote for a pool with bribes, you receive a share proportional to your voting power.
3. Rebase
Additional rewards for voters based on their underlying LUNA amount. The yield generated by z-assets held in the system flows back to voters as rebase.
z-assets are an internal accounting mechanism. When you claim rewards, you receive ampLUNA, bLUNA, or LUNA — not z-assets directly.

sections.title: Amplified vs Non-Amplified
sections.intro: How you stake your LP affects how rewards work.

content.value: Non-Amplified (Manual)
Rewards paid in LUNA. You claim manually and decide what to do with them. If you spend rewards without reinvesting, the 10% annual take rate slowly reduces your LP position over time.
Amplified (Auto-Compound)

Rewards automatically used to buy more of your LP pair and add to your position. This compounds your stake, outpaces the take rate, and creates trading volume on LUNA pairs as the system routes through LUNA to acquire assets.
With non-amplified positions, if you claim and spend rewards without adding back to your LP, you're effectively slowly selling your position through the take rate.

sections.title: Take Rate & PoL
sections.intro: 10% of staked LP value goes to Protocol-Owned Liquidity annually.

content.value: The take rate captures a portion of LP deposits and sends it to Terra's Community Pool. This builds permanent, unspent liquidity that doesn't need ongoing incentives.
Why It Matters

items: Builds lasting liquidity infrastructure
Reduces long-term dependence on incentives
Creates a treasury of productive assets
Managed by Phoenix Foundation on behalf of the community

content.value: Amplified positions naturally outpace the take rate through compounding. For non-amplified, reinvesting rewards keeps you ahead.

sections.title: Impermanent Loss
sections.intro: When assets in your LP diverge in price, you may have less value than if you'd just held.

content.value: Providing liquidity means agreeing to continuous rebalancing. The pool automatically sells the asset that's rising and buys the one that's falling. If prices diverge significantly from your entry, you experience IL.
IL by Price Divergence
IL is 'impermanent' because if prices return to your entry ratio, the loss disappears. It becomes permanent only when you withdraw at a different ratio.
Minimizing IL

items: Correlated pairs — Assets that move together (LUNA-ampLUNA) have minimal IL
Stablecoin pairs — USDC-USDT rarely diverges from 1:1
Same ecosystem — LUNA-ATOM tend to move somewhat together
Stableswap pools — Designed for assets that should be ~1:1

content.value: The real question: Do your rewards (LP fees + TLA emissions + bribes) outpace your IL? High APR doesn't help if IL eats your principal.

sections.title: Asset Correlation
sections.intro: How assets move together affects your IL risk.

content.value: Assets in the same ecosystem or category tend to move together. When both sides of your LP move in the same direction, IL is reduced.
Correlation Groups
Market Dynamics

BTC tends to lead market movements. When BTC moves 5-10%, altcoins often move 10-30% in the same direction. This amplification effect means LUNA-USDC pairs can experience significant IL during market swings, while LUNA-ATOM pairs may see both assets move together.
This is observation, not prediction. Markets can decorrelate unexpectedly. Always consider your own risk tolerance.

sections.title: ERIS Protocol
sections.intro: The team behind TLA and Terra's liquid staking infrastructure.

content.value: ampLUNA (Liquid Staking)

Deposit LUNA, receive ampLUNA. Your stake earns rewards that auto-compound daily. Stay liquid while earning staking yield. 21-day unbonding period applies, or swap instantly on DEX with a small premium.
arbLUNA (Arbitrage Pool)
Captures the 1-2% premium from instant ampLUNA→LUNA swaps. Deposit LUNA, receive arbLUNA. An automated bot executes arbitrage opportunities. 25-day withdrawal period with declining exit fee.
Amp Governance (vAMP)

Lock ampLUNA for voting power on validator selection. Lock duration: 3 weeks to 2 years. Voting power multiplier: 1.3x (3 weeks) to 10x (2 years). Vote on up to 3 validators with the same voting power.
ERIS follows a 'Real Yield' philosophy — no platform token. ampLUNA holders receive 50% of protocol performance fees.

After TFL disbanded in 2024, Phoenix Foundation formed to guide Terra's development. It's a network of teams working together through a BORG structure that combines on-chain governance with real-world accountability.
Structure

items: Terra Governance DAO — All stakers, ultimate veto power
Phoenix Think Tank — Active builders, brainstorm and vet proposals
Phoenix Task Forces — Execute specific initiatives
Phoenix Stewardship — Administrative oversight
Phoenix Treasury — Funded via Alliance Module (10% reward weight)

content.value: Funding & Oversight

The Treasury receives ~10% of Terra's staking inflation through a virtual token staked in the Alliance Module. Spending locks: >$50k requires 3-day Think Tank review, >$150k requires 10-day governance review. Terra Governance can delist the virtual token to stop funding at any time.

sections.title: Pool Types
sections.intro: Different pool mechanics for different asset pairs.

content.value: Constant Product (XYK)
Formula: X × Y = K. Liquidity spread across all prices. Best for volatile pairs. Higher slippage but works at any price. Fee: 0.3% (0.2% LPs, 0.1% xASTRO).
Stableswap
Concentrated around 1:1 ratio. Best for pairs that should trade near parity (stables, LST pairs). Very low slippage near target price. Fee: 0.05%.
PCL (Passive Concentrated Liquidity)

Auto-concentrates liquidity around current price. Better capital efficiency than XYK. Pool automatically 'repegs' when profitable. Dynamic fees increase during volatility. Best for medium-volatility pairs.
Pool type affects both your fee income and IL exposure. Stableswap pools have minimal IL for pegged assets. XYK handles extreme moves better than PCL.

sections.title: Bridging & Origins
sections.intro: How assets reach Terra affects their trust profile.

content.value: IBC (Native)
Inter-Blockchain Communication. Trustless light-client verification between Cosmos chains. No intermediaries. ATOM, OSMO, and other Cosmos assets use IBC natively.
IBC Eureka
IBC v2 extending to Ethereum. Uses zero-knowledge proofs for trustless verification. Launched April 2025. Lower fees than bridge alternatives. PAXG reached Terra via Eureka.
Axelar
Validator network bridge. Connects non-IBC chains. Subject to validator trust assumptions. Experienced an exploit in July 2024 (IBC hooks vulnerability) that temporarily isolated Terra.

sections.title: Votion
sections.intro: Vote optimization tool for TLA and Hydro.

content.value: Votion calculates optimal vote allocations to maximize your expected rewards. It gathers reward data from pools, estimates USD returns for different vote distributions, and shows recommendations.
What It Shows

items: Available pools and their TVL
Current APY estimates
Vote recommendations for maximizing rewards
Expected additional earnings from optimization

content.value: Votion handles the math so you don't have to manually calculate which vote distribution gives you the best return.

glossary.APR: Annual Percentage Rate. Simple interest, not compounded. 10% APR on $100 = $10/year.
glossary.APY: Annual Percentage Yield. Includes compounding. Higher than APR for same rate if compounding frequently.
glossary.Amplified: Auto-compounding LP position. Rewards automatically reinvested into your LP.
glossary.Bribe: Incentive added by projects to attract votes. Voters who vote for bribed pools share the bribe.
glossary.Bucket: Category of pools in TLA (Stable, Project, Bluechip, Single). Each has separate voting.
glossary.Epoch: One-week period in TLA. Runs Sunday to Sunday 12:00 UTC.
glossary.IL: Impermanent Loss. Value reduction from LP rebalancing when asset prices diverge.
glossary.IBC: Inter-Blockchain Communication. Trustless bridge protocol for Cosmos chains.
glossary.LST: Liquid Staking Token. Receipt token for staked assets (ampLUNA, bLUNA).
glossary.PCL: Passive Concentrated Liquidity. Pool type that auto-concentrates liquidity around current price.
glossary.PoL: Protocol-Owned Liquidity. Permanent liquidity owned by Terra Community Pool.
glossary.Rebase: Yield from z-assets distributed to voters based on locked LUNA amount.
glossary.Take Rate: 10% annual rate captured from staked LPs for Protocol-Owned Liquidity.
glossary.TVL: Total Value Locked. USD value of assets deposited in a pool or protocol.
glossary.vAMP: Vote-escrowed ampLUNA. Locked ampLUNA for governance voting power.
glossary.ve(3,3): Voting escrow model where locking tokens grants voting power over reward distribution.
glossary.VP: Voting Power. Influence you have from locking tokens. Increases with lock duration.
glossary.XYK: Constant product pool. X × Y = K formula. Liquidity spread across all prices.
glossary.z-asset: Internal accounting token representing LST principle. Used for reward distribution.
glossary.Zap: Converting one asset to another (or to LP) in a single transaction.
